segments.text: My eyes keep returning to that poor, wobbly stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is so focused on those cookies, he doesn't seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Its legs are really splayed out; it looks like it could tip at any moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's stretching so far, putting all his weight on one side.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is watching him with such hopeful eyes, completely unaware of the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can almost picture him falling backward, cookies scattering everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a wonder he hasn't tumbled already, given the angle of that thing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And if he falls, he'll land right on that wet floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That would certainly make a splash, literally and figuratively.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone really ought to secure that stool or tell him to get down.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a recipe for disaster, plain and simple.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I truly hope he manages to get his cookies without an accident.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Such a small risk for such a sweet reward.
segments.speaker: PAR
